alert.note: Alert for Merrimack (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 24 at 5:35AM EST until December 24 at 11:00PM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in New Hampshire... Piscataquog River near Goffstown affecting Hillsborough County. Suncook River At North Chichester affecting Belknap and Merrimack Counties. ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in New Hampshire... Warner River At Davisville affecting Merrimack County. For the PISCATAQUOG RIVER...including Goffstown...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Warner River...including Davisville...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Suncook River...including North Chichester...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Warner River at Davisville. * WHEN...Until this evening. * IMPACTS...At 6.5 feet, Although no structures are affected, water inundates recreational areas in Warner and Davisville. The river is at bankfull in other reaches, some erosion may occur. At 8.0 feet, Riverside Road floods along with increasing depths over recreational fields in Warner. At 10.0 feet, Low lying roads along the Warner River begin to have a flood threat. The most flood prone areas include West Joppa Road in Warner, cutting off access to the Dalton covered bridge. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:30 AM EST Saturday the stage was 8.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is cresting now, and will then fall below flood stage late this afternoon. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/gray.
